diagnosis.final_diagnosis: hemophilic pseudotumor of the left forearm
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with painful swelling and an open wound in the left forearm, with a history of hemophilia and a significantly low factor-VIII level. Radiographs showed soft-tissue swelling, subperiosteal new-bone formation, cortical erosion, and lytic lesions, supporting the diagnosis of a hemophilic pseudotumor.
